meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Azerbaijan.
meanings.sent1: In Azerbaijan, you can buy many things with just one manat.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for Azerbaijani manat at the bank.
meanings.sent3: Why did the manat go to school? To learn how to multiply!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand manat.
meanings.sent5: The shiny manat coin glinted in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Turkmenistan.
meanings.sent1: I need to exchange my dollars for Turkmenistani manat before my trip.
meanings.sent2: The price of the souvenir was listed in Turkmenistani manat.
meanings.sent3: The manat rolled off the table and onto the floor, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: His words carried more weight than any amount of manat.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread filled the market where manat changed hands.

meanings.definition: A type of currency used in various countries in the Middle East.
meanings.sent1: Many Middle Eastern countries accept manat as a form of payment.
meanings.sent2: The exchange rate for Omani rial to manat was favorable.
meanings.sent3: The manat in his pocket jingled as he walked down the street.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a melody, more precious than any manat.
meanings.sent5: The colorful banknotes of manat fluttered in the breeze.
